it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.linkingrules

Class AdaptiveRange<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.linkingrules.EuclideanDistance<T>
      • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.linkingrules.AdaptiveRange<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILinkingRule<T>, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SelectiveAdaptiveRange

    public class AdaptiveRange<T>
extends EuclideanDistance<T>
    This linking rule dynamically searches for the best radius for each device, in such a way that it connects to a certain number of devices.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AdaptiveRange

        public AdaptiveRange(double radius,
                     double minrange,
                     double maxrange,
                     int num,
                     int tolerance)
        Parameters:
        radius - default radius in metres
        minrange - minimum radius in metres
        maxrange - maximum radius in metres
        num - preferred number of neighbors
        tolerance - if the number of neighbors is smaller than num-tolerance, the radius is increased; if the number of neighbors is higher than num+tolerance, the radius is decreased

      • AdaptiveRange

        public AdaptiveRange(double radius,
                     double minrange,
                     double maxrange,
                     int num,
                     int tolerance,
                     double adjustment)
        Parameters:
        radius - default radius in metres
        minrange - minimum radius in metres
        maxrange - maximum radius in metres
        num - preferred number of neighbors
        tolerance - if the number of neighbors is smaller than num-tolerance, the radius is increased; if the number of neighbors is higher than num+tolerance, the radius is decreased
        adjustment - the amount of metres the range will be changed if out of the bounds

      • computeNeighborhood

        public final INeighborhood<T> computeNeighborhood(INode<T> center,
                                                  IEnvironment<T> env)
        Description copied from interface: ILinkingRule
        Produces a new neighborhood for specified node considering its position.
        Specified by:
        computeNeighborhood in interface ILinkingRule<T>
        Overrides:
        computeNeighborhood in class EuclideanDistance<T>
        Parameters:
        center - the node to recompute
        env - the node's environment
        Returns:
        a neighborhood

      • conditionForRemoval

        protected boolean conditionForRemoval(IEnvironment<T> env,
                                      INode<T> center,
                                      INode<T> neighbor,
                                      double centerRange,
                                      double neighRange)
        Acts as a filter. It is called to test if the nodes in the computed neighborhood (namely, those nodes within the communication range of the current node) should be removed or not, and must return true if the node should not be inserted in the neighborhood. This implementation checks that the actual distance between the nodes is shorter than the communication range of the neighbor.
        Parameters:
        env - the current environment
        center - the current node
        neighbor - the neighbor to test
        centerRange - the communication range of the current node
        neighRange - the communication range of the neighbor
        Returns:
        true if the node must be removed, false otherwise
